intro: Lycianthes chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but have a mild, sometimes bitter taste. Lycianthes chiriquensis is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
